If this is too simplistic just say so. If it seems like I'm skimming over something it isn't because I'm pulling a fast one, I'm just hitting the highlights here.
 
 Atoms are made up of protons, neutrons, and electrons. All atoms with 6 protons are carbon. Most carbon atoms also have 6 neutrons, and we call those atoms carbon 12. But some carbon have 8 neutrons, and we call those carbon 14. I'll abreviate those as C12 and C14 from now on. The important thing about C12 and C14 is that C12 is stable, while C14 isn't. C14 has a half life of 5730 years, which means that if you start with 1 pound of C14, in 5730 years you'll only have 1/2 pound left.
 
 The atmosphere contains carbon in the form of Carbon Dioxide, or C02. Some of that carbon is C12, and some is C14. The ratio of C12 to C14 in the air is pretty much fixed. There's been some variation, but not enough to matter for this level of discussion. When plants grow, they take in CO2 and use it as building material. That means that plants have a set ratio of C12 to C14. Anything that eats the plant will also have that ratio, and anything that eats that animal will too. In other words, pretty much every living thing big enough to see has the same ratio of C12 to C14 as the air does. That is, until they die. Once they die they no longer are replenishing their C14. At that point the fact that C14 decays comes into play. You can measure the ratio of C12 to C14 in a sample of organic matter to great accuracy, and compare it to the ratio that it would have if it were alive. By looking at the difference, and knowing that half the C14 is going away every 5730 years, you can tell how long ago something died. One caveat. The amount of C14 in the air isn't very large, so any given living thing won't have a large amount of it. That means that after about 60,000 years there simply won't be enough C14 in a sample to get an accurate reading, so that's the limit for C14 dating.
 
 So that's it. Nothing but chemistry and math, all well documented. The process is so simple that I can't imagine any way that it could be wrong. So if you can show any way that it could be wrong, other than it disagrees with your beliefs, go ahead and explain.
